newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: BIRZU NAFTOTIEKIS SAYS TRANSPORTED 5.2 MLN TONNES OF CRUDE OIL AND RELATED PRODUCTS IN Q1 1997.
newsitem.headline: BIRZU NAFTOTIEKIS SAYS TRANSPORTED 5.2 MLN TONNES OF CRUDE OIL AND RELATED PRODUCTS IN Q1 1997.

text.p: Lithuania's pipeline operator Birzu Naftotiekis said on Friday that its preliminary profit in April was 4.8 million litas.

The finance director of the company Ona Shlamiene also told Reuters that the profit of the company in the first quarter of the year was down to 5.3 million litas compared to 9.04 million litas in the same period in 1996.

"Though our profit decreased in the first quarter we have no doubt that we will reach our target of around 40 million litas net profit at the end of the year and the April results prove it," Shlamiene said.
The company's net profit for all of 1996 was 39.5 million litas.
Shlamiene also said that the company's sales and services in the first quarter of 1997 rose to 20.6 million litas versus 16.4 million litas in the same period last year.
The company transports crude oil and oil products from Russia to Lithuania's oil refinery Mazeikiu Nafta and Latvia's Ventspils port.
"In the first quarter of 1997 we transported 5.2 million tonnes of crude and oil products compared to 4.6 million tonnes in the same period last year," Shlamiene said.

Of this, 856,464 tonnes of crude was transported to Mazeikiu Nafta and 3.58 million tonnes to Ventspils in the first three months of the year compared respectively to 643,000 and 3.26 million tonnes of crude in the same period in 1996, she said.
"The 1997 first quarter figures were finally presented and approved by the economy ministry on Thursday," Shlamiene added.

The company is 90 percent state-run and Lithuania's government said earlier that it was planning to merge the company into an oil concern together with Mazeikiu Nafta, Butinges Nafta and Lietuvos Kuras.
